title: Milan Wiedemann
text:
I’m a researcher and health data scientist at the Bennett Institute for Applied Data Science at the University of Oxford. I enjoy developing tools in R and Python that help to analyse clinical data and bring evidence into practice:

ehrQL is a query language written in Python that our team designed to make it easy to work with electronic health records
suddengains and lcsm are R packages that my colleagues and I developed to understand changes in clinical measures during psychological therapy
